DOCNAME: BOZINOVSKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a national of the former GPE , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On an unspecified date the applicant 's niece Ms D. instituted civil proceedings with ORG disputing the applicant 's title to a part of a house .

On DATE ORG granted PERSON claim . It found that her late father , who was the applicant 's brother , with the knowledge of the previous owner of the house , had invested a considerable amount of money for its refurbishment and , thereby , he had acquired a title to part of the house in accordance with the relevant provision of ORG . On DATE ORG upheld the above judgment .

On DATE ORG quashed the lower courts ' judgments . It referred the case back for re - examination to ORG and instructed it to order an expert valuation whereby the value of PERSON father 's investment would be determined in a precise manner .
On DATE the experts submitted their report . They concluded that PERSON late father 's investment represented PERCENT of the value of the relevant part of the house after its refurbishment .
At the hearing of CARDINAL DATE several witnesses appeared before ORG .

On DATE the applicant made written submissions to the court . It objected to the expert report and requested that an additional expert report be prepared in respect of the value of the investment made by PERSON late father .
A hearing was held on DATE before ORG .
In DATE the applicant was served with the additional expert report .
On DATE the applicant objected to the additional expert report and asked the court to appoint new experts . From the applicant 's submissions it appears that the court did not grant his request .
Another hearing was held on DATE before ORG .

On DATE ORG granted PERSON claim , as it found , on the basis of the witnesses ' statements , expert report and additional expert report , that her late father had obtained the title to the disputed part of the house on the basis of the investment made .
On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG . He complained , inter alia , that the lower court assessed the evidence wrongly and refused to appoint new experts .

On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant 's appeal . It held , inter alia , that the expert report covered all the important issues , that on the applicant 's request an additional expert report had been prepared and that the report was corroborated with other evidence .
The applicant received the judgment on DATE .
